707624f-a.text:
896-900 First Ave., east side, between East 50th (Dunscomb Place) and 51st Streets. No. 900; the 2-story building, is a blacksmith shop.

September 20, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

707622f.text:
West side Of First Avenue, south of 50th Street. March 20, 1928.

P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

713436f-a.text:
(1)

50th Street, north side, west from but not including First Ave., showing the Beekman Hill Methodist Episcopal Church.

March 20, 1928.

P. L. Sperr

(2)

The same, showing more of the buildings on the right.

March 20, 1928.

P. L. Sperr

This edifice was purchased (about 1920) by the First Reformed Episcopal Church, formerly located at the N.E. corner of Madison Avenue and E. 55th Street. For details of same--see page 390-1 of Moses Kings Handbook of N. Y. 1893.

707623f-a.text:
891-901 First Avenue, at the N.W. corner of E. 50th Street, showlng a new apartment house whioh was erected on the former site of a group of 4 story brick tenements.
July 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr

713435f-a.text:
343-351 East 50th Street, north side, west of First Ave.
About 1922.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

713434f-a.text:
50th Street, south side, west from 35 west of First Ave.

December 28, 1930.

P.L. Sperr.
